channel.title: Dash on Memo Tut
channel.description: Recent content in Dash on Memo Tut

item.title: [Python] Created a new Kyoto corona app with Python web framework Dash
item.description: I created a new Kyoto corona app using the Python web framework Dash. [Dash](https://dash.plotly.com/) is a framework created using Flask, React, and Plotly, which allows you to quickly create dashboard-like applications. You can also use callbacks to drive your application interactively. It's a framework that makes it easy for people who like data kneading like me but who don't know React or Vue very well. The created application can be found at the following URL.

item.title: [Python] Visualize coronavirus infection status with Plotly [For beginners]
item.description: Next time https://qiita.com/Naoya_Study/items/851f4032fb6e2a5cd5ed With the spread of coronavirus infection, various organizations have released cool dashboards that visualize the infection status. Example 1 WHO Novel Coronavirus (COVID-19) Situation Example 2 Ministry of Health, Labor and Welfare new coronavirus infection domestic case Example 3 Toyo Keizai ONLINE New Coronavirus Domestic Infection Status It is cool! I want to be able to make this myself. The goal is to create a dashboard like the one above using Python’s visualization-specific data frame Dash.

item.title: [Python] A network diagram was created with COVID-19 data.
item.description: ## Introduction Create a graph, network diagram, and data table based on the Ministry of Health, Labor and Welfare COVID-19 infection status data and create a Web application. Did. The created app will be the one with the link below. App link: https://chomoku.herokuapp.com/covid-19 Below is the screen of the network diagram. < /a> The data used is obtained from the Ministry of Health, Labor and Welfare website. Scraping is just using the pandas read_html function.
